conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram and apply the first law of thermodynamics.
Process A to B is isochoric (constant volume) at 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Process B to C is isobaric (constant pressure) at 1 x 10^5 Pa.
Work done from A to B is zero because it's an isochoric process.
Work done from B to C is 200 J using W = PΔV.
Change in internal energy for an ideal gas depends on temperature change.
Temperature at A is 27°C or 300 K.
Temperature at B is 100 K using P/T relation for isochoric process.
Temperature at C is 300 K using V/T relation for isobaric process.
Change in internal energy from A to C is zero because temperatures are the same.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
The heat transferred to the gas is 200 J.
